arguments.summary_text: John Doe (father) was diagnosed with chronic hypertension at his PCP visit on 2025-11-27 after repeated elevated in-office blood pressures. No prior antihypertensive medications or related complications are documented yet. He was advised to begin home blood-pressure monitoring and coordinate a follow-up visit to initiate pharmacologic therapy if readings remain high. Reinforce heart-healthy diet, exercise, weight control, and limit sodium/alcohol. Pending tasks: track home BP logs, schedule PCP follow-up, and discuss cardiovascular risk labs if not done recently.
